intro: Silene gavrilovii, commonly known as the Gavrilovii catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Silene gavrilovii is considered a rare and endangered species.
